host.description: This is the Emarsys API server

info.description:
The Email Campaigns API enables you to programmatically create, manage, update, and retrieve email campaigns, including handling campaign versions, recipient sources, categories, languages, and blocklists. 
You would use it to automate and integrate sophisticated email marketing workflows within your applications or systems, streamlining campaign management and personalization at scale.
info.title: SAP Emarsys Core - Email Campaigns

externalDocs.description: For more information, please visit our official SAP Emarsys developer portal.

x-sap-shortText: Create and maintain email campaign data for your marketing needs.

post.description:
Creates an email campaign with the specified parameters.

**Note:** For further information about creating emails with transaction-specific content, see [Using the API to Create Triggered Messages](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_EMARSYS/f8e2fafeea804018a954a8857d9dfff3/fdeca77574c11014bbebfefbede19ae4.html) and [Capturing Transactional Content](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-core-api-guides/982fbd9d6c462-capture-transactional-content). For the list of possible campaign related placeholders, see [Email personalization placeholders](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-core-api-guides/ddb458580a19f-email-personalization-placeholders).

To disable the automatic link-tracking temporarily when creating an email campaign use `keep_raw_html` and `keep_raw_text` with the value of `1` in the call:

```
 "keep_raw_html": 1,
 "keep_raw_text": 1 
```

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

id.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

event_id.description:
0 = ad-hoc campaign
9 = automation center campaign
10 = triggered e-mail campaign

schema.description: **Important**: At least one of the following parameters is required for specifying the recipient source: `external_event_id`, `filter`, `combined_segment` or `contactlist`.

language.description: The language of the email campaign. See [Language code](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/docs/appendix/language-codes.md) for details.

fromemail.description: The email address of the sender. Email addresses here are **case-sensitive**! Provide the address with the right casing, or the allow-list will not recognize it.

email_category.description:
The category identifier that the email is assigned to.

Provide the value _0_ if the email campaign does not have a category.

For details, see [Querying Email Campaign Categories](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/bu4dpp9za0832-get-email-campaign-categories).

html_source.description:
The HTML body of the email.

**Note**: Not available for template-based campaigns.

text_source.description:
The plain text source of the email.

**Note**: Not available for template-based campaigns.

external_event_id.description:
The identifier of the external event for the email.

If provided, creates an email campaign with an _External Event_ as the recipient source.

filter.description:
The segment identifier for the email.

If provided, creates an email campaign with a _Segment_ as the recipient source.

combined_segment_id.description:
The identifier of the combined segment for the email.

If provided, creates an email campaign with a _Combined Segment_ as the recipient source.

contactlist.description:
The identifier of the contact list for the email.

If provided, creates an email campaign with a _Contact list_ as the recipient source.

administrator.description:
The identifier of one of the customerâ€™s admins.

The e-mail is not bound to the default administrator (typically the one called admin).

template.description: The identifier of the template for creating a template-based campaign.

unsubscribe.description: If provided, the email conzains and unsubscribe lion

browse.description: If provided, the email contains a link to an online version.

text_only.description:
If provided, the email is sent in plain text only.

Only works if both the HTML and plain text sources are available.

cc_list.description:
The identifier of the contact list to receive a copy of the email.

**Note**: Only works if the BCC List feature is enabled for the customer.

additional_linktracking_parameters.description:
Creates additional URL parameters that are added to the tracked links URL on redirect.

**Note**: Only works if this feature is enabled for the customer.

exclude_filter.description: Excludes the specified segment from the recipient list.

exclude_contact_list_id.description: Excludes the specified contact list from the recipient list.

link_domain_id.description: The identifier of the link domain for the email.

get.description:
Returns a list of existing email campaigns. Filter the results by specifying a campaign by its identifier, set a date range, or use other query parameters. 

**Note:** It is recommended to list campaigns in shorter date ranges when requesting a large amount of data.

parameters.name: is_rti
parameters.description: Specifies whether the campaign supports Interactions.

parameters.name: email_category
parameters.description:
The identifier of the campaign.

**Note:**  Multiple values are allowed, separated by a comma without whitespace.

parameters.name: behavior_channel
parameters.description: The channel type.

parameters.name: parent_campaign_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the parent campaign. Set to *0* if the email campaign is not a recurring child campaign.

parameters.name: campaign_type
parameters.description:
The type of the campaign.

**Note:** Multiple values are allowed, separated by a comma without whitespace.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description:
The type of the content.

**Note:** Multiple values are allowed, separated by a comma without whitespace.

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: The identifier of the template. Set to *0* if there is no template.

parameters.name: root_campaign_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the root campaign ID. Set to *0* if the campaign is not versioned.

parameters.name: todate
parameters.description: Lists campaigns created before the specified date. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: fromdate
parameters.description: Lists campaigns created after the specified date. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: showdeleted
parameters.description:
Filters deleted campaigns.

Supported values:
- *0*: Deleted campaigns are ignored
- *1*: Lists deleted campaigns as well

parameters.name: contactlist
parameters.description: The identifier of the contact list. Set to *0* if no contact list is defined.

parameters.name: launched
parameters.description:
Filters campaigns by their launch status.

Supported values:
- *0*: Not launched
- *1*: Launched

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the campaign. See [Email status and error codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-core-api-guides/0d03290b9ddcc-email-status-and-error-codes) for details.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

language.description: The email language. For details, see [language codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-core-api-guides/dbdc7035d4ea6-language-codes).

deleted.description: Deletion date of the email (if applicable).

fromemail_host.description: Indicates whether Emarsys reply mail management is used (`emarsys`) or not (`external`).

api_status.description: The launch status of the campaign. For details, see [Email status and error codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-core-api-guides/0d03290b9ddcc-email-status-and-error-codes).

api_error.description: Any specific error related to the endpoints or methods.

fromname.description: The name of the email sender.

subject.description: The subject line of the email.

email_category.description: The category identifier of the email. See also [Email status and error codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-core-api-guides/0d03290b9ddcc-email-status-and-error-codes).

filter.description: The identifier of the associated segment included from the recipient source. Available filters can be retrieved at the [List segments](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/74xbd653gcpzz-list-segments) endpoint.

browse.description: Indicates whether the email contains a link to the online version.

contactlist.description: The identifier of the associated contact list included in the recipient source. Available contact lists can be retrieved at the [List Contact Lists](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/axpotjvepqdla-list-contact-lists) endpoint.

template.description: The identifier of the email template.

cc_list.description:
The identifier of the contact list to receive a copy of the email.

**Note:** Only works if the *BCC List* feature is enabled.

root_campaign_id.description: The identifier of the root campaign. Only available for versioned campaigns.

version_name.description: The name of the root campaign. Only available for versioned campaigns.

features.description: The list of features enabled in the campaign. Returns an empty array if no features are enabled.

get.description: Returns the details of an email campaign, such as content and attributes, including personalized text and HTML source.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The identifier of the campaign.

parameters.name: raw_html
parameters.description: Returns the raw html data of the email.

parameters.name: raw_text
parameters.description:
Returns the actual links of the email content with the original URLs instead of the tracking URLs.

**Note:** Using this parameter also affects the `html_source` and `text_source` fields in the response.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

language.description: The email language. For details, see [language codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-core-api-guides/dbdc7035d4ea6-language-codes).

created.description: The creation date of the email.

deleted.description: The deletion date of the email (if applicable).

fromemail_host.description: Indicates whether Emarsys reply mail management is used (`emarsys`) or not (`external`).

api_status.description: The launch status of the campaign. For details, see [Email status and error codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-core-api-guides/0d03290b9ddcc-email-status-and-error-codes).

api_error.description: Any specific error related to the endpoints or methods.

fromname.description: The name of the email sender.

subject.description: The subject line of the email.

email_category.description: The category identifier of the email. See also .

filter.description: The identifier of the associated segment included from the recipient source. Available filters can be retrieved at the [List segments](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/74xbd653gcpzz-list-segments) endpoint.

contactlist.description: The identifier of the associated contact list included in the recipient source. Available contact lists can be retrieved at the [List Contact Lists](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/axpotjvepqdla-list-contact-lists) endpoint.

template.description: The identifier of the email template.

cc_list.description:
The identifier of the contact list to receive a copy of the email.

**Note:** Only works if the *BCC List* feature is enabled.

html_source.description: The HTML source of the email.

text_source.description: The plain text source of the email.

root_campaign_id.description: The identifier of the root campaign. Only available for versioned campaigns.

version_name.description: The name of the root campaign. Only available for versioned campaigns.

exclude_filter.description: The identifier of the associated segment excluded from the recipient source. Available filters can be retrieved at the [List segments](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/74xbd653gcpzz-list-segments) endpoint.

exclude_contactlist.description: The identifier of the associated contact list excluded in the recipient source. Available contact lists can be retrieved at the [List Contact Lists](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/axpotjvepqdla-list-contact-lists) endpoint.

additional_linktracking_parameters.description:
Additional URL parameters that are added to the tracked links URL when redirected.

 **Note**: Only works if this feature is enabled for the customer.

unsubscribe.description: Indicates whether the email contains an unsubscribe link.

browse.description: Indicates whether the email contains a link to the online version.

external_event_id.description:
The external event identifier of the email.

**Note:** Only available if the campaign has an external event recipient source.

text_only.description: Indicates whether the email only cantains a plain text version.

features.description: The list of features enabled in the campaign. Returns an empty array if no features are enabled.

campaign_types.description:
The type of the email campaign.

| Identifier | Type |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | Promotion email |
| 2 | Newsletter |
| 3 | Event-driven email |
| 4 | Test |
| 5 | Fulltest |

force_attachment.description: Indicates whether external event trigger requests require an attachment

rti_trigger.description: Indicates whether the campaign supports Interactions

get.description: Returns a list of languages available for creating emails. For a list of supported languages, see [Language codes](docs/appendix/language-codes.md).

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

get.description: Returns the alphabetized list of email campaign categories available for creating email campaigns.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

id.description: The identifier of the campaign category.

category.description: The name of the campaign category.

post.summary: Update an Email Campaign Recipient Source
post.description:
You must set the **Recipient source** setting to **Using the API** in the Emarsys application to assign a segment or a contact list to an email campaign using the API.

The recipient source is filtered by the specified segment or contact list. To narrow the recipient list further, provide exclusion filters.

**Important:** If you do not explicitly set any exclusion filters, all existing exclusions are removed from the campaign.

**Warning:** The recipient source parameter can only be changed once if the previous value was set to **Using the API**.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

emailId.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

filterId.description:
The identifier of the recipient source segment.

**Important:** At least the `filterId` or the `contactlistId` must be specified, and must not be *0*. The property with the value *0* is ignored.

contactlistId.description:
The identifier of the recipient source contact list.

**Important:** At least the `filterId` or the `contactlistId` must be specified, and must not be *0*. The property with the value *0* is ignored.

excludeFilterId.description:
Excludes the specified segment from the receipient source. If *0*, all existing exclusion segments are removed from the recipient source.

**Note:** If either `excludeFilterId` and `excludeContactlistId`is not specified, existing exclusions are removed from the campaign. If both are specified, `excludeFilterId` is ignored.

excludeContactlistId.description:
Excludes the specified contact list from the receipient source. If *0*, all existing exclusion contact lists are removed from the recipient source.

**Note:** If either `excludeFilterId` or `excludeContactlistId` is not specified, existing exclusions are removed from the campaign. If both are specified, `excludeFilterId` is ignored.

post.description:
Updates an email campaign with the specified parameters.

Email campaigns are locked during updates to prevent overlapping concurrent updates that may cause problems. A new update process can be started **only** after the one in progress has finished. You cannot make an update request while there is an on-going update. 

**Note:** Already launched campaigns cannot be modified.

**Important:** This endpoint **does not** work with VCE campaigns. Updating VCE campaigns must be done through the UI.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The identifier of the campaign.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

id.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

root_email.description: The identifier of the root campaign. Only available for versioned campaigns.

language.description: The email language. For details, see [language codes](docs/appendix/language-codes.md).

name.description: The name of the email campaign.

created.description: The creation date of the email.

deleted.description: The deletion date of the email (if applicable).

fromname.description: The name of the email sender.

subject.description: The subject line of the email.

email_category.description: The category identifier of the email. See also [Email status and error codes](docs/personalization/email-status-and-error-codes.md).

filter.description: The identifier of the associated segment included from the recipient source. Available filters can be retrieved at the [List segments](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-api/b3A6MjQ4OTk4NDk) endpoint.

contactlist.description: The identifier of the associated contact list included in the recipient source. Available contact lists can be retrieved at the [List Contact Lists](/reference/openapi.json/paths/~1v3~1contactlist/get) endpoint.

additional_linktracking_parameters.description:
Additional URL parameters that are added to the tracked links URL when redirected.

**Note:**

cc_list.description:
The identifier of the contact list to receive a copy of the email.

**Note:** Only works if the *BCC List* feature is enabled.

html_source.description:
The HTML body of the email.

**Note:** Not available for template-based campaigns.

text_source.description:
The plain text source of the email.

**Note:** Not available for template-based campaigns.

unsubscribe.description: If true, the email contains an unsubscribe link.

browse.description: If true, the email contains a link to an online version.

api_status.description: The launch status of the campaign. For details, see [Email status and error codes](docs/personalization/email-status-and-error-codes.md).

api_error.description: Any specific error related to the endpoints or methods.

text_only.description: Indicates whether the email only cantains a plain text version.

additional_linktracking_parameters.description:
Additional URL parameters that are added to the tracked links URL when redirected.

**Note:** Only available if the feature is enabled.

language.description: The language of the email campaign. For details, see [Language codes](docs/appendix/language-codes.md).

subject.description:
The subject of the campaign.

**Note:** Cannot be empty.

text_source.description:
The plain text source of the email.

**Note:** Not available for template-based campaigns.

html_source.description:
The HTML body of the email.

**Note:** Not available for template-based campaigns.

fromemail.description: The email address of the sender.

unsubscribe.description: If provided, the email contains an unsubscribe link.

browse.description: If provided, the email contains a link to an online version.

contactlist.description:
The identifier of the contact list for the email.

If provided, updates the email campaign with the given *Contact list* as the recipient source.

emailId.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

post.description:
Creates a new child version of the specified email campaign.

Versioned campaigns are optimal for A/B testing, and can be manipulated as a separate email campaign through the API.

**Tip:** List all versions of an email campaign with `root_campaign_id` filter on the [List email campaigns](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-api/b3A6MjQ4OTk4Njg) endpoint.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](docs/response-codes/error-codes.md) for details.

data.description: The identifier of the new campaign.

original_name.description:
The name of the original campaign to create a new version of.

**Important:** Only needed if the campaign has not been versioned yet.

new_name.description: The name of the new version of the campaign.

post.description:
During A/B testing of multi-language campaigns, two versions are sent to contacts with the same mother tongue living in the same country. Once the A/B testing is completed, finalize the email campaign using this endpoint. Contacts in the specified countries will then receive the successful version in their own languages.

**Note:** This endpoint is only available if the *Multi-language Email Campaigns* feature is enabled for your account. Contact Emarsys Support for details.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](docs/response-codes/error-codes.md) for details.

post.description: Makes a copy of an email campaign, optionally with a new name.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

campaignId.description: The identifier of the new campign.

name.description:
The name of the new email campaign.

**Note:** If a new name is not specified, a unique name is automatically generated.

post.description:
Adds emails and domains to the internal blocklist. Blocklisted entries are not participating in any campaign.

**Note:** The maximum batch size is 1000 emails and 1000 domains per call.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](docs/response-codes/error-codes.md) for details.

emails.description: The list of emails put on the blocklist.

domains.description: The list of domains put on the blocklist.

emails.description: List of emails to be put on the blocklist.

domains.description: List of domains to be put on the blocklist.

get.summary: List AC Programs That Use an Email Campaign
get.description: Returns a list of AC programs that use the specified email campaign.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The id of the campaign used by the AC programs you want to get.

name.description: The name of the AC program.

default-response-example.title: Default response

replyCode.description: The Emarsys response code. Successful requests return 0; otherwise, see [errors](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/jir98la21pufy-http-400-errors).

replyText.description: Additional information on the status of the request.

data.description: Contains the requested data, if applicable.

default-response-example.description: This is the generic SAP Emarsys response.

oauth2ClientCredentials.description: To use this API, you must first obtain an OAuth 2.0 client credentials token. After that you can use the token to call the API. For more information, see [Authentication](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-core-api-guides/branches/OAuth-2.0/b3c3a1eba8515-authentication-in-v3-api).
